 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else

 window.onload = function() {

 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;

    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;

        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>

              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    k<kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    j<kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                up/down in the list<span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    o<kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    Enter<kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                open the current issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    Shift-O<kbd><!---->Shift-O<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        Description #1 by leecraso@gmail.com (Feb 24, 2021)

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>When deleting a clipboard content, |DeleteItemWithCommandId()| will be called by |ExecuteCommand()|[1]. If the content is the last one in the clipboard, the |context_menu_| will be reset[2], which causes the |ClipboardHistoryItemView| to be destroyed. <span class="line"><!---->When deleting a clipboard content, |DeleteItemWithCommandId()| will be called by |ExecuteCommand()|[1]. If the content is the last one in the clipboard, the |context_menu_| will be reset[2], which causes the |ClipboardHistoryItemView| to be destroyed. <!----></span><br><br>After that, when |Activate()| is exited, the destructor of the local variable |action_to_take|[3] will be call. Then access[4] to |scoped_variable_|(|action_|[5], member variable of |ClipboardHistoryItemView|) triggers UAF.<span class="line"><!---->After that, when |Activate()| is exited, the destructor of the local variable |action_to_take|[3] will be call. Then access[4] to |scoped_variable_|(|action_|[5], member variable of |ClipboardHistoryItemView|) triggers UAF.<!----></span><br><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=324<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=324"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=324<!----></a><br>[2]. <span class="line"><!---->[2]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/clipboard_history_controller_impl.cc;l=444<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/clipboard_history_controller_impl.cc;l=444"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/clipboard_history_controller_impl.cc;l=444<!----></a><br>[3]. <span class="line"><!---->[3]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=318<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=318"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=318<!----></a><br>[4]. <span class="line"><!---->[4]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:base/auto_reset.h;l=42<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:base/auto_reset.h;l=42"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:base/auto_reset.h;l=42<!----></a><br>[5]. <span class="line"><!---->[5]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.h;l=185<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.h;l=185"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.h;l=185<!----></a><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: ChromeOS<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: ChromeOS<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<span class="line"><!---->$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<!----></span><br>$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<span class="line"><!---->$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span><br>Right click the textarea field and choose "Clipboard".<span class="line"><!---->Right click the textarea field and choose "Clipboard".<!----></span><br>Delete the content and the bug will be triggered.<span class="line"><!---->Delete the content and the bug will be triggered.<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see asan file<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see asan file<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 2<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1181676#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1181676#c10">Comment 10<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Feb 25, 2021, 9:39 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>

        @leecraso Thank you for catching this ASAN issue. CL is finished: <span class="line"><!---->@leecraso Thank you for catching this ASAN issue. CL is finished: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2720645<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2720645"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2720645<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>Since it is a security issue, more details of the CL are disclosed here:<span class="line"><!---->Since it is a security issue, more details of the CL are disclosed here:<!----></span><br><br>This CL does two things:<span class="line"><!---->This CL does two things:<!----></span><br>(1) Avoid destructing the multipaste menu entries synchronously when the multipaste menu is closed. Instead, we should rely on ClipboardHistoryControllerImpl::OnMenuClosed to do it in the asynchronous way. Otherwise, it may run into UAF errors if the view accesses its data members after triggering the command to close the multipaste menu.<span class="line"><!---->(1) Avoid destructing the multipaste menu entries synchronously when the multipaste menu is closed. Instead, we should rely on ClipboardHistoryControllerImpl::OnMenuClosed to do it in the asynchronous way. Otherwise, it may run into UAF errors if the view accesses its data members after triggering the command to close the multipaste menu.<!----></span><br><br>(2) When menu is closed, ClipboardHistoryMenuModelAdapter should terminate any asynchronous calls on `RemoveItemView()`. Otherwise it may trigger UAF errors as well. In addition, it is pointless to update the menu view if the menu has been closed. For this particular case, no crash or ASAN error has been reported yet. But we should still fix it.<span class="line"><!---->(2) When menu is closed, ClipboardHistoryMenuModelAdapter should terminate any asynchronous calls on `RemoveItemView()`. Otherwise it may trigger UAF errors as well. In addition, it is pointless to update the menu view if the menu has been closed. For this particular case, no crash or ASAN error has been reported yet. But we should still fix it.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

      </style>
      <mr-description></mr-description>
      <mr-comment-list headinglevel="2"></mr-comment-list>
      
    <!----></mr-issue-details>
              
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      <style>
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        <div class="target-project-dialog">
          <h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

          <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });

 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">

 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else

 }

 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };
</script><script src="/static/dist/mr-app.21b50eb242e773ee421c.min.js" nonce="" type="module"></script>
    .__crdxFeedbackButton {
      background-image: url('https://storage.cloud.google.com/chops-feedback/icon.png');
      background-size: cover;
      bottom: 32px;
      height: 32px;
      opacity: .4;
      position: fixed;
      right: 24px;
      text-decoration: none;
      transition: opacity .2s;
      width: 32px;
      z-index: 8675309; /* Jenny */

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>When deleting a clipboard content, |DeleteItemWithCommandId()| will be called by |ExecuteCommand()|[1]. If the content is the last one in the clipboard, the |context_menu_| will be reset[2], which causes the |ClipboardHistoryItemView| to be destroyed. <span class="line"><!---->When deleting a clipboard content, |DeleteItemWithCommandId()| will be called by |ExecuteCommand()|[1]. If the content is the last one in the clipboard, the |context_menu_| will be reset[2], which causes the |ClipboardHistoryItemView| to be destroyed. <!----></span><br><br>After that, when |Activate()| is exited, the destructor of the local variable |action_to_take|[3] will be call. Then access[4] to |scoped_variable_|(|action_|[5], member variable of |ClipboardHistoryItemView|) triggers UAF.<span class="line"><!---->After that, when |Activate()| is exited, the destructor of the local variable |action_to_take|[3] will be call. Then access[4] to |scoped_variable_|(|action_|[5], member variable of |ClipboardHistoryItemView|) triggers UAF.<!----></span><br><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=324<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=324"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=324<!----></a><br>[2]. <span class="line"><!---->[2]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/clipboard_history_controller_impl.cc;l=444<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/clipboard_history_controller_impl.cc;l=444"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/clipboard_history_controller_impl.cc;l=444<!----></a><br>[3]. <span class="line"><!---->[3]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=318<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=318"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=318<!----></a><br>[4]. <span class="line"><!---->[4]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:base/auto_reset.h;l=42<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:base/auto_reset.h;l=42"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:base/auto_reset.h;l=42<!----></a><br>[5]. <span class="line"><!---->[5]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.h;l=185<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.h;l=185"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.h;l=185<!----></a><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: ChromeOS<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: ChromeOS<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<span class="line"><!---->$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<!----></span><br>$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<span class="line"><!---->$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span><br>Right click the textarea field and choose "Clipboard".<span class="line"><!---->Right click the textarea field and choose "Clipboard".<!----></span><br>Delete the content and the bug will be triggered.<span class="line"><!---->Delete the content and the bug will be triggered.<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see asan file<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see asan file<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<span class="line"><!---->Reporter         @leecraso Thank you for catching this ASAN issue. CL is finished: <span class="line"><!---->@leecraso Thank you for catching this ASAN issue. CL is finished: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2720645<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2720645"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2720645<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>Since it is a security issue, more details of the CL are disclosed here:<span class="line"><!---->Since it is a security issue, more details of the CL are disclosed here:<!----></span><br><br>This CL does two things:<span class="line"><!---->This CL does two things:<!----></span><br>(1) Avoid destructing the multipaste menu entries synchronously when the multipaste menu is closed. Instead, we should rely on ClipboardHistoryControllerImpl::OnMenuClosed to do it in the asynchronous way. Otherwise, it may run into UAF errors if the view accesses its data members after triggering the command to close the multipaste menu.<span class="line"><!---->(1) Avoid destructing the multipaste menu entries synchronously when the multipaste menu is closed. Instead, we should rely on ClipboardHistoryControllerImpl::OnMenuClosed to do it in the asynchronous way. Otherwise, it may run into UAF errors if the view accesses its data members after triggering the command to close the multipaste menu.<!----></span><br><br>(2) When menu is closed, ClipboardHistoryMenuModelAdapter should terminate any asynchronous calls on `RemoveItemView()`. Otherwise it may trigger UAF errors as well. In addition, it is pointless to update the menu view if the menu has been closed. For this particular case, no crash or ASAN error has been reported yet. But we should still fix it.<span class="line"><!---->(2) When menu is closed, ClipboardHistoryMenuModelAdapter should terminate any asynchronous calls on `RemoveItemView()`. Otherwise it may trigger UAF errors as well. In addition, it is pointless to update the menu view if the menu has been closed. For this particular case, no crash or ASAN error has been reported yet. But we should still fix it.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>

        Given that this requires user interaction, this can be lowered to a P1 per <span class="line"><!---->Given that this requires user interaction, this can be lowered to a P1 per <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/docs/+/master/security_severity_guidelines.md#High-Severity<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/docs/+/master/security_severity_guidelines.md#High-Severity"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/docs/+/master/security_severity_guidelines.md#High-Severity<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> but we definitely want to merge it to 89. Thanks Andrew for all the work so far.<span class="line"><!----> but we definitely want to merge it to 89. Thanks Andrew for all the work so far.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        Setting Pri-1 to match security severity High. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<span class="line"><!---->Setting Pri-1 to match security severity High. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

      </button>

         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

          position: relative;
        }

          border-collapse: collapse;

           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */

        }

          display: block;

        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;

          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

                <span class="key-shortcut">

                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>
      <chops-dialog>
        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts

            Close
          </button>
        </h2>
        <div class="keyboard-help">
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">

                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>

                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>

                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>

                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>
