        @leecraso Thank you for catching this ASAN issue. CL is finished: <span class="line"><!---->@leecraso Thank you for catching this ASAN issue. CL is finished: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2720645<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2720645"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2720645<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>Since it is a security issue, more details of the CL are disclosed here:<span class="line"><!---->Since it is a security issue, more details of the CL are disclosed here:<!----></span><br><br>This CL does two things:<span class="line"><!---->This CL does two things:<!----></span><br>(1) Avoid destructing the multipaste menu entries synchronously when the multipaste menu is closed. Instead, we should rely on ClipboardHistoryControllerImpl::OnMenuClosed to do it in the asynchronous way. Otherwise, it may run into UAF errors if the view accesses its data members after triggering the command to close the multipaste menu.<span class="line"><!---->(1) Avoid destructing the multipaste menu entries synchronously when the multipaste menu is closed. Instead, we should rely on ClipboardHistoryControllerImpl::OnMenuClosed to do it in the asynchronous way. Otherwise, it may run into UAF errors if the view accesses its data members after triggering the command to close the multipaste menu.<!----></span><br><br>(2) When menu is closed, ClipboardHistoryMenuModelAdapter should terminate any asynchronous calls on `RemoveItemView()`. Otherwise it may trigger UAF errors as well. In addition, it is pointless to update the menu view if the menu has been closed. For this particular case, no crash or ASAN error has been reported yet. But we should still fix it.<span class="line"><!---->(2) When menu is closed, ClipboardHistoryMenuModelAdapter should terminate any asynchronous calls on `RemoveItemView()`. Otherwise it may trigger UAF errors as well. In addition, it is pointless to update the menu view if the menu has been closed. For this particular case, no crash or ASAN error has been reported yet. But we should still fix it.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>When deleting a clipboard content, |DeleteItemWithCommandId()| will be called by |ExecuteCommand()|[1]. If the content is the last one in the clipboard, the |context_menu_| will be reset[2], which causes the |ClipboardHistoryItemView| to be destroyed. <span class="line"><!---->When deleting a clipboard content, |DeleteItemWithCommandId()| will be called by |ExecuteCommand()|[1]. If the content is the last one in the clipboard, the |context_menu_| will be reset[2], which causes the |ClipboardHistoryItemView| to be destroyed. <!----></span><br><br>After that, when |Activate()| is exited, the destructor of the local variable |action_to_take|[3] will be call. Then access[4] to |scoped_variable_|(|action_|[5], member variable of |ClipboardHistoryItemView|) triggers UAF.<span class="line"><!---->After that, when |Activate()| is exited, the destructor of the local variable |action_to_take|[3] will be call. Then access[4] to |scoped_variable_|(|action_|[5], member variable of |ClipboardHistoryItemView|) triggers UAF.<!----></span><br><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=324<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=324"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=324<!----></a><br>[2]. <span class="line"><!---->[2]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/clipboard_history_controller_impl.cc;l=444<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/clipboard_history_controller_impl.cc;l=444"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/clipboard_history_controller_impl.cc;l=444<!----></a><br>[3]. <span class="line"><!---->[3]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=318<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=318"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=318<!----></a><br>[4]. <span class="line"><!---->[4]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:base/auto_reset.h;l=42<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:base/auto_reset.h;l=42"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:base/auto_reset.h;l=42<!----></a><br>[5]. <span class="line"><!---->[5]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.h;l=185<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.h;l=185"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.h;l=185<!----></a><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: ChromeOS<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: ChromeOS<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<span class="line"><!---->$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<!----></span><br>$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<span class="line"><!---->$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span><br>Right click the textarea field and choose "Clipboard".<span class="line"><!---->Right click the textarea field and choose "Clipboard".<!----></span><br>Delete the content and the bug will be triggered.<span class="line"><!---->Delete the content and the bug will be triggered.<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see asan file<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see asan file<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<span class="line"><!---->Reporter         @leecraso Thank you for catching this ASAN issue. CL is finished: <span class="line"><!---->@leecraso Thank you for catching this ASAN issue. CL is finished: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2720645<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2720645"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2720645<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>Since it is a security issue, more details of the CL are disclosed here:<span class="line"><!---->Since it is a security issue, more details of the CL are disclosed here:<!----></span><br><br>This CL does two things:<span class="line"><!---->This CL does two things:<!----></span><br>(1) Avoid destructing the multipaste menu entries synchronously when the multipaste menu is closed. Instead, we should rely on ClipboardHistoryControllerImpl::OnMenuClosed to do it in the asynchronous way. Otherwise, it may run into UAF errors if the view accesses its data members after triggering the command to close the multipaste menu.<span class="line"><!---->(1) Avoid destructing the multipaste menu entries synchronously when the multipaste menu is closed. Instead, we should rely on ClipboardHistoryControllerImpl::OnMenuClosed to do it in the asynchronous way. Otherwise, it may run into UAF errors if the view accesses its data members after triggering the command to close the multipaste menu.<!----></span><br><br>(2) When menu is closed, ClipboardHistoryMenuModelAdapter should terminate any asynchronous calls on `RemoveItemView()`. Otherwise it may trigger UAF errors as well. In addition, it is pointless to update the menu view if the menu has been closed. For this particular case, no crash or ASAN error has been reported yet. But we should still fix it.<span class="line"><!---->(2) When menu is closed, ClipboardHistoryMenuModelAdapter should terminate any asynchronous calls on `RemoveItemView()`. Otherwise it may trigger UAF errors as well. In addition, it is pointless to update the menu view if the menu has been closed. For this particular case, no crash or ASAN error has been reported yet. But we should still fix it.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>

Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1.         Setting Pri-1 to match security severity High. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<span class="line"><!---->Setting Pri-1 to match security severity High. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>When deleting a clipboard content, |DeleteItemWithCommandId()| will be called by |ExecuteCommand()|[1]. If the content is the last one in the clipboard, the |context_menu_| will be reset[2], which causes the |ClipboardHistoryItemView| to be destroyed. <span class="line"><!---->When deleting a clipboard content, |DeleteItemWithCommandId()| will be called by |ExecuteCommand()|[1]. If the content is the last one in the clipboard, the |context_menu_| will be reset[2], which causes the |ClipboardHistoryItemView| to be destroyed. <!----></span><br><br>After that, when |Activate()| is exited, the destructor of the local variable |action_to_take|[3] will be call. Then access[4] to |scoped_variable_|(|action_|[5], member variable of |ClipboardHistoryItemView|) triggers UAF.<span class="line"><!---->After that, when |Activate()| is exited, the destructor of the local variable |action_to_take|[3] will be call. Then access[4] to |scoped_variable_|(|action_|[5], member variable of |ClipboardHistoryItemView|) triggers UAF.<!----></span><br><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=324<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=324"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=324<!----></a><br>[2]. <span class="line"><!---->[2]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/clipboard_history_controller_impl.cc;l=444<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/clipboard_history_controller_impl.cc;l=444"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/clipboard_history_controller_impl.cc;l=444<!----></a><br>[3]. <span class="line"><!---->[3]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=318<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=318"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=318<!----></a><br>[4]. <span class="line"><!---->[4]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:base/auto_reset.h;l=42<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:base/auto_reset.h;l=42"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:base/auto_reset.h;l=42<!----></a><br>[5]. <span class="line"><!---->[5]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.h;l=185<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.h;l=185"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.h;l=185<!----></a><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: ChromeOS<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: ChromeOS<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<span class="line"><!---->$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<!----></span><br>$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<span class="line"><!---->$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span><br>Right click the textarea field and choose "Clipboard".<span class="line"><!---->Right click the textarea field and choose "Clipboard".<!----></span><br>Delete the content and the bug will be triggered.<span class="line"><!---->Delete the content and the bug will be triggered.<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see asan file<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see asan         @leecraso Thank you for catching this ASAN issue. CL is finished: <span class="line"><!---->@leecraso Thank you for catching this ASAN issue. CL is finished: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2720645<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2720645"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2720645<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>Since it is a security issue, more details of the CL are disclosed here:<span class="line"><!---->Since it is a security issue, more details of the CL are disclosed here:<!----></span><br><br>This CL does two things:<span class="line"><!---->This CL does two things:<!----></span><br>(1) Avoid destructing the multipaste menu entries synchronously when the multipaste menu is closed. Instead, we should rely on ClipboardHistoryControllerImpl::OnMenuClosed to do it in the asynchronous way. Otherwise, it may run into UAF errors if the view accesses its data members after triggering the command to close the multipaste menu.<span class="line"><!---->(1) Avoid destructing the multipaste menu entries synchronously when the multipaste menu is closed. Instead, we should rely on ClipboardHistoryControllerImpl::OnMenuClosed to do it in the asynchronous way. Otherwise, it may run into UAF errors if the view accesses its data members after triggering the command to close the multipaste menu.<!----></span><br><br>(2) When menu is closed, ClipboardHistoryMenuModelAdapter should terminate any asynchronous calls on `RemoveItemView()`. Otherwise it may trigger UAF errors as well. In addition, it is pointless to update the menu view if the menu has been closed. For this particular case, no crash or ASAN error has been reported yet. But we should still fix it.<span class="line"><!---->(2) When menu is closed, ClipboardHistoryMenuModelAdapter should terminate any asynchronous calls on `RemoveItemView()`. Otherwise it may trigger UAF errors as well. In addition, it is pointless to update the menu view if the menu has been closed. For this particular case, no crash or ASAN error has been reported yet. But we should still fix it.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>

        Given that this requires user interaction, this can be lowered to a P1 per <span class="line"><!---->Given that this requires user interaction, this can be lowered to a P1 per <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/docs/+/master/security_severity_guidelines.md#High-Severity<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/docs/+/master/security_severity_guidelines.md#High-Severity"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/docs/+/master/security_severity_guidelines.md#High-Severity<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> but we definitely want to merge it to 89. Thanks Andrew for all the work so far.<span class="line"><!----> but we definitely want to merge it to 89. Thanks Andrew for all the work so far.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        Setting Pri-1 to match security severity High. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<span class="line"><!---->Setting Pri-1 to match security severity High. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Description #1 by leecraso@gmail.com (Feb 24, 2021)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by leecraso@gmail.com (Feb 24, 2021)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by leecraso@gmail.com (Feb 24, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by leecraso@gmail.com (Feb 24, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>When deleting a clipboard content, |DeleteItemWithCommandId()| will be called by |ExecuteCommand()|[1]. If the content is the last one in the clipboard, the |context_menu_| will be reset[2], which causes the |ClipboardHistoryItemView| to be destroyed. <span class="line"><!---->When deleting a clipboard content, |DeleteItemWithCommandId()| will be called by |ExecuteCommand()|[1]. If the content is the last one in the clipboard, the |context_menu_| will be reset[2], which causes the |ClipboardHistoryItemView| to be destroyed. <!----></span><br><br>After that, when |Activate()| is exited, the destructor of the local variable |action_to_take|[3] will be call. Then access[4] to |scoped_variable_|(|action_|[5], member variable of |ClipboardHistoryItemView|) triggers UAF.<span class="line"><!---->After that, when |Activate()| is exited, the destructor of the local variable |action_to_take|[3] will be call. Then access[4] to |scoped_variable_|(|action_|[5], member variable of |ClipboardHistoryItemView|) triggers UAF.<!----></span><br><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=324<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=324"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=324<!----></a><br>[2]. <span class="line"><!---->[2]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/clipboard_history_controller_impl.cc;l=444<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/clipboard_history_controller_impl.cc;l=444"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/clipboard_history_controller_impl.cc;l=444<!----></a><br>[3]. <span class="line"><!---->[3]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=318<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=318"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=318<!----></a><br>[4]. <span class="line"><!---->[4]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:base/auto_reset.h;l=42<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         @leecraso Thank you for catching this ASAN issue. CL is finished: <span class="line"><!---->@leecraso Thank you for catching this ASAN issue. CL is finished: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2720645<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2720645"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2720645<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>Since it is a security issue, more details of the CL are disclosed here:<span class="line"><!---->Since it is a security issue, more details of the CL are disclosed here:<!----></span><br><br>This CL does two things:<span class="line"><!---->This CL does two things:<!----></span><br>(1) Avoid destructing the multipaste menu entries synchronously when the multipaste menu is closed. Instead, we should rely on ClipboardHistoryControllerImpl::OnMenuClosed to do it in the asynchronous way. Otherwise, it may run into UAF errors if the view accesses its data members after triggering the command to close the multipaste menu.<span class="line"><!---->(1) Avoid destructing the multipaste menu entries synchronously when the multipaste menu is closed. Instead, we should rely on ClipboardHistoryControllerImpl::OnMenuClosed to do it in the asynchronous way. Otherwise, it may run into UAF errors if the view accesses its data members after triggering the command to close the multipaste menu.<!----></span><br><br>(2) When menu is closed, ClipboardHistoryMenuModelAdapter should terminate any asynchronous calls on `RemoveItemView()`. Otherwise it may trigger UAF errors as well. In addition, it is pointless to update the menu view if the menu has been closed. For this particular case, no crash or ASAN error has been reported yet. But we should still fix it.<span class="line"><!---->(2) When menu is closed, ClipboardHistoryMenuModelAdapter should terminate any asynchronous calls on `RemoveItemView()`. Otherwise it may trigger UAF errors as well. In addition, it is pointless to update the menu view if the menu has been closed. For this particular case, no crash or ASAN error has been reported yet. But we should still fix it.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        This is a serious security regression. If you are not able to fix this quickly, please revert the change that introduced it.<span class="line"><!---->This is a serious security regression. If you are not able to fix this quickly, please revert the change that introduced it.<!----></span><br><br>If this doesn't affect a release branch, or has not been properly classified for severity, please update the Security_Impact or Security_Severity labels, and remove the ReleaseBlock label. menu entries synchronously when<!----></span><br>the multipaste menu is closed.<span class="line"><!---->the multipaste menu is closed.<!----></span><br><br>(2) When menu is closed,         Setting Pri-1 to match security severity High. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<span class="line"><!---->Setting Pri-1 to match security severity High. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>When deleting a clipboard content, |DeleteItemWithCommandId()| will be called by |ExecuteCommand()|[1]. If the content is the last one in the clipboard, the |context_menu_| will be reset[2], which causes the |ClipboardHistoryItemView| to be destroyed. <span class="line"><!---->When deleting a clipboard content, |DeleteItemWithCommandId()| will be called by |ExecuteCommand()|[1]. If the content is the last one in the clipboard, the |context_menu_| will be reset[2], which causes the |ClipboardHistoryItemView| to be destroyed. <!----></span><br><br>After that, when |Activate()| is exited, the destructor of the local variable |action_to_take|[3] will be call. Then access[4] to |scoped_variable_|(|action_|[5], member variable of |ClipboardHistoryItemView|) triggers UAF.<span class="line"><!---->After that, when |Activate()| is exited, the destructor of the local variable |action_to_take|[3] will be call. Then access[4] to |scoped_variable_|(|action_|[5], member variable of |ClipboardHistoryItemView|) triggers UAF.<!----></span><br><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=324<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=324"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=324<!----></a><br>[2]. <span class="line"><!---->[2]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/clipboard_history_controller_impl.cc;l=444<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/clipboard_history_controller_impl.cc;l=444"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/clipboard_history_controller_impl.cc;l=444<!----></a><br>[3]. <span class="line"><!---->[3]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=318<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=318"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=318<!----></a><br>[4]. <span class="line"><!---->[4]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:base/auto_reset.h;l=42<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:base/auto_reset.h;l=42"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:base/auto_reset.h;l=42<!----></a><br>[5]. <span class="line"><!---->[5]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.h;l=185<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.h;l=185"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.h;l=185<!----></a><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: ChromeOS<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: ChromeOS<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<span class="line"><!---->$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<!----></span><br>$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<span class="line"><!---->$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span><br>Right click the textarea field and choose "Clipboard".<span class="line"><!---->Right click the textarea field and choose "Clipboard".<!----></span><br>Delete the content and the bug will be triggered.<span class="line"><!---->Delete the content and the bug will be triggered.<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see asan file<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see asan file<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<span class="line"><!---->Reporter         @leecraso Thank you for catching this ASAN issue. CL is finished: <span class="line"><!---->@leecraso Thank you for catching this ASAN issue. CL is finished: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2720645<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2720645"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2720645<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>Since it is a security issue, more details of the CL are disclosed here:<span class="line"><!---->Since it is a security issue, more details of the CL are disclosed here:<!----></span><br><br>This CL does two things:<span class="line"><!---->This CL does two things:<!----></span><br>(1) Avoid destructing the multipaste menu entries synchronously when the multipaste menu is closed. Instead, we should rely on ClipboardHistoryControllerImpl::OnMenuClosed to do it in the asynchronous way. Otherwise, it may run into UAF errors if the view accesses its data members after triggering the command to close the multipaste menu.<span class="line"><!---->(1) Avoid destructing the multipaste menu entries synchronously when the multipaste menu is closed. Instead, we should rely on ClipboardHistoryControllerImpl::OnMenuClosed to do it in the asynchronous way. Otherwise, it may run into UAF errors if the view accesses its data members after triggering the command to close the multipaste menu.<!----></span><br><br>(2) When menu is closed, ClipboardHistoryMenuModelAdapter should terminate any asynchronous calls on `RemoveItemView()`. Otherwise it may trigger UAF errors as well. In addition, it is pointless to update the menu view if the menu has been closed. For this particular case, no crash or ASAN error has been reported yet. But we should still fix it.<span class="line"><!---->(2) When menu is closed, ClipboardHistoryMenuModelAdapter should terminate any asynchronous calls on `RemoveItemView()`. Otherwise it may trigger UAF errors as well. In addition, it is pointless to update the menu view if the menu has been closed. For this particular case, no crash or ASAN error has been reported yet. But we should still fix it.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This is a serious security regression. If you are not able to fix this quickly, please revert the change that introduced it.<span class="line"><!---->This is a serious security regression.       </div><br>
    
        
      
        Given that this requires user interaction, this can be lowered to a P1 per <span class="line"><!---->Given that this requires user interaction, this can be lowered to a P1 per <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/docs/+/master/security_severity_guidelines.md#High-Severity<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/docs/+/master/security_severity_guidelines.md#High-Severity"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/docs/+/master/security_severity_guidelines.md#High-Severity<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> but we definitely want to merge it to 89. Thanks Andrew for all the work so far.<span class="line"><!----> but we definitely want to merge it to 89. Thanks Andrew for all the work so far.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        Setting Pri-1 to match security severity High. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<span class="line"><!---->Setting Pri-1 to match security severity High. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>When deleting a clipboard content, |DeleteItemWithCommandId()| will be called by |ExecuteCommand()|[1]. If the content is the last one in the clipboard, the |context_menu_| will be reset[2], which causes the |ClipboardHistoryItemView| to be destroyed. <span class="line"><!---->When deleting a clipboard content, |DeleteItemWithCommandId()| will be called by |ExecuteCommand()|[1]. If the content is the last one in the clipboard, the |context_menu_| will be reset[2], which causes the |ClipboardHistoryItemView| to be destroyed. <!----></span><br><br>After that, when |Activate()| is exited, the destructor of the local variable |action_to_take|[3] will be call. Then access[4] to |scoped_variable_|(|action_|[5], member variable of |ClipboardHistoryItemView|) triggers UAF.<span class="line"><!---->After that, when |Activate()| is exited, the destructor of the local variable |action_to_take|[3] will be call. Then access[4] to |scoped_variable_|(|action_|[5], member variable of |ClipboardHistoryItemView|) triggers UAF.<!----></span><br><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=324<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=324"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=324<!----></a><br>[2]. <span class="line"><!---->[2]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/clipboard_history_controller_impl.cc;l=444<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/clipboard_history_controller_impl.cc;l=444"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/clipboard_history_controller_impl.cc;l=444<!----></a><br>[3]. <span class="line"><!---->[3]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=318<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=318"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.cc;l=318<!----></a><br>[4]. <span class="line"><!---->[4]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:base/auto_reset.h;l=42<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:base/auto_reset.h;l=42"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:base/auto_reset.h;l=42<!----></a><br>[5]. <span class="line"><!---->[5]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.h;l=185<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.h;l=185"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/88.0.4324.205:ash/clipboard/views/clipboard_history_item_view.h;l=185<!----></a><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: ChromeOS<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: ChromeOS<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<span class="line"><!---->$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<!----></span><br>$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<span class="line"><!---->$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span><br>Right click the textarea field and choose "Clipboard".<span class="line"><!---->Right click the textarea field and choose "Clipboard".<!----></span><br>Delete the content and the bug will be triggered.<span class="line"><!---->Delete the content and the bug will be triggered.<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see asan file<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see asan         What was the version of chrome you built from and what were the GN options.<span class="line"><!---->What was the version of chrome you built from and what were the GN options.<!----></span><br>I don't see that context menu when I build and run chromium (on linux) from: <span class="line"><!---->I don't see that context menu when I build and run chromium (on linux) from: <!----></span>c73b5a651d37a6c4d0b8e3262cc4015a5579c6c8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c73b5a651d37a6c4d0b8e3262cc4015a5579c6c8"><!---->c73b5a651d37a6c4d0b8e3262cc4015a5579c6c8<!----></a> (stable) with these GN args:<span class="line"><!----> (stable) with these GN args:<!----></span><br>target_os = "chromeos"<span class="line"><!---->target_os = "chromeos"<!----></span><br>use_goma = true<span class="line"><!---->use_goma = true<!----></span><br>is_asan = true<span class="line"><!---->is_asan = true<!----></span><br>is_debug = false<span class="line"><!---->is_debug = false<!----></span><br>is_component_build = false<span class="line"><!---->is_component_build = false<!----></span><br>is_lsan = true<span class="line"><!---->is_lsan = true<!----></span><br>v8_enable_verify_heap = true<span class="line"><!---->v8_enable_verify_heap = true<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        @leecraso Thank you for catching this ASAN issue. CL is finished: <span class="line"><!---->@leecraso Thank you for catching this ASAN issue. CL is finished: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2720645<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2720645"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2720645<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>Since it is a security issue, more details of the CL are disclosed here:<span class="line"><!---->Since it is a security issue, more details of the CL are disclosed here:<!----></span><br><br>This CL does two things:<span class="line"><!---->This CL does two things:<!----></span><br>(1) Avoid destructing the multipaste menu entries synchronously when the multipaste menu is closed. Instead, we should rely on ClipboardHistoryControllerImpl::OnMenuClosed to do it in the asynchronous way. Otherwise, it may run into UAF errors if the view accesses its data members after triggering the command to close the multipaste menu.<span class="line"><!---->(1) Avoid destructing the multipaste menu entries synchronously when the multipaste menu is closed. Instead, we should rely on ClipboardHistoryControllerImpl::OnMenuClosed to do it in the asynchronous way. Otherwise, it may run into UAF errors if the view accesses its data members after triggering the command to close the multipaste menu.<!----></span><br><br>(2) When menu is closed, ClipboardHistoryMenuModelAdapter should terminate any asynchronous calls on `RemoveItemView()`. Otherwise it may trigger UAF errors as well. In addition, it is pointless to update the menu view if the menu has been closed. For this particular case, no crash or ASAN error has been reported yet. But we should still fix it.<span class="line"><!---->(2) When menu is closed, ClipboardHistoryMenuModelAdapter should terminate any asynchronous calls on `RemoveItemView()`. Otherwise it may trigger UAF errors as well. In addition, it is pointless to update the menu view if the menu has been closed. For this particular case, no crash or ASAN error has been reported yet. But we should still fix it.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2"></mr-comment>
      
      
      
        
          Comment 11<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1181676#c11">Comment 11<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

        This bug requires manual review: We are only 2 days from stable.<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: We are only 2 days from stable.<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>
      <label for="checkbox">
        <slot></slot>
      </label>
    Send email<chops-checkbox id="sendEmail">Send email</chops-checkbox>
          
            
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
              Discard
            <chops-button id="discard" class="de-emphasized">
              Discard
            </chops-button>
            
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
              Save changes
            <chops-button id="save" class="emphasized">

            </chops-button>
          <div>
            <chops-button id="discard" class="de-emphasized">
              Discard
            </chops-button>

        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
